Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Manpowergroup Talent Solutions, estamos buscando un Data Analyst para incorporar en cliente final.




Nuestro cliente es un grupo multinacional industrial, líder en el mercado en su actividad, con un negocio consolidado y rentable, que por otra parte se encuentra en un interesante momento de transformación.




Misión del puesto:

Dar soporte a los diferentes principales clientes internos de la compañía en el análisis y la gestión del dato. Análisis de la información a partir de los datos existentes y obtención de insights relevantes que apoyen, de forma activa, la toma de decisiones de negocio.




Funciones y responsabilidades clave:

Responsable de consolidación de BBDD.
Creación de informes y dashboards que faciliten el análisis del performance de la compañía por parte de los diferentes departamentos y managers a los que dará soporte para servir de apoyo en la toma de decisiones.
Generación de análisis y propuesta de acciones.
Obtención de insights relevantes a partir del estudio, interconexión y análisis de la información existente.
Participación en proyectos relacionados con Inteligencia Artificial (IA).
Análisis y evaluación de las propuestas que se realizan.




Competencias Clave: (se realizará prueba práctica durante el proceso)

Capacidad analítica avanzada.

Excel: avanzado.

Power BI: avanzado.

SQL: avanzado.

SAP: deseable.

Salesforce: deseable.

Python: deseable.

Google Analytics: deseable.




Idiomas:

Español.

Inglés: mínimo B2, deseable C1




Experiencia:

≥ 3 años de experiencia gestionando datos y reporting.
Experiencia en generación de dashboards o cuadros de mandos para apoyar la toma de decisiones de negocio.
Deseable experiencia en contacto directo con equipos comerciales.




Perfil:

Analíticamente avanzado.
Autonomía y proactividad.
Visión del análisis desde las necesidades del cliente y el negocio.
Facilidad para el manejo de diferentes clientes internos en jerarquías de la organización.
Orientación a resultados y a generación de negocio.
Capacidad emprendedora y creativa.
Excelentes capacidades en la resolución de problemas.




Ubicación:

Sevilla




Modalidad:

Teletrabajo híbrido




Si te apasiona el análisis de datos, cuentas con experiencia en la creación de dashboards que transforman información en decisiones clave, y buscas un entorno dinámico en el que puedas crecer y desarrollar tu carrera, ¡queremos conocerte! ¡Postúlate ahora y da el siguiente paso en tu carrera profesional!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a DATA ANALYST con experiencia mínima de 3 años para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo💥




¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Por qué trabajar aquí?




👉FORMACIÓN PERSONALIZADA: Dispondrás de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars y Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching...

👉MODELO DE TRABAJO HIBRIDO: 1 día oficina (zona Viladecans)

👉PAQUETE DE RETRIBUCIÓN FLEXIBLE: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).

👉SOMOS UNA FAMILIA: Cuidamos de esta gran familia organizando afterworks, cenas y eventos 🍻.




Experiencia:

Desarrollar análisis de datos complejos, aplicando distintas metodologías matemáticas y/o estadísticas para recopilar, organizar, interpretar y resumir datos numéricos para proporcionar información utilizable a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar informes y/o entregables relacionados con datos relevantes para la toma de decisiones, así como sus presentaciones a los equipos de negocio.
Apoyar al equipo de Business Insights en su desarrollo, proporcionando asistencia técnica y entendimiento entre los miembros sobre el uso eficaz de los datos y sus mejores prácticas.
Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos y B.I.).
Ser el focal en las mesas de trabajo con las áreas de negocio para mostrar resultados y avances, siendo capaz de priorizar y planificar el trabajo/proyecto que esté bajo su gestión.
Llevar a cabo investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas y utilizar enfoques de métodos mixtos para el análisis de datos, según necesidades de negocio.




Requisitos:

Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de negocio o analista de datos.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA. Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Alta capacidad analítica y manejo en modelos de datos: sólida experiencia en SQL, Python (deseable) y gestión de Big Data.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con varias áreas y stakeholders.
Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema, imaginar una solución y estructurarla.
Habilidad estructurando la información, analizándola y extrayendo datos según necesidades de negocio.
Se valorará experiencia en herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Inglés Avanzado




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países, por lo que podrás disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura, como en este caso.




💙¡SOMOS UN EXCELENTE LUGAR DE TRABAJO! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Show more

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
We are the Nestlé Nespresso SA Company and are proud to be one of the fastest growing operating unit of Nestlé. Our passionate, entrepreneurial-minded team has transformed Nespresso into the reference in portioned coffee and one of the world’s most trusted brands. Our growth comes from our commitment to research and development in order to pioneer and be the reference in the portioned coffee sector to provide the very highest quality coffees that could be enjoyed in the comfort of consumers' own homes and also savored at out-of-home locations, such as restaurants, hotels, offices and luxury retail businesses. We guarantee quality by taking a careful, thoughtful approach in how we source our ingredients, produce and market our premium coffee products. With corporate headquarters in Lausanne, Switzerland, Nespresso is present in over 60 countries and counts over 12,000 employees worldwide. To learn more visit www.nespresso.com.

We are looking for a Data & Insight Analyst to be part of our Customer Journey Analytics Team

Position Snapshot


Location: Esplugues de Llobregat
Type of contract: Permanent, Full time.
Team: Insights, Analytics and Data Science
Work Language: Business Fluent English


The Role

The Data & Insights Analyst plays a critical role in leveraging data to provide strategic insights, supporting decision-making processes and driving continuous improvement within the Customer Journey Analytics team.

What You´ll Do


Provide Reports and Ad-Hoc analysis on customer data sales such as monthly KPIs, markets performance, campaign pre and post analysis, channels and products performance.
Analyze complex issues and be able to significantly improve, change or adapt existing methods and techniques according to business needs (from different functions: Finance, CRM, Coffee, Retail, Consumer...).
Build and share with CRM team (marketes and HQ) insignts and recommendations based on customer centric activities.
Be responsible on guiding and supporting Markets and Zones with business decisions.


Minimum Qualifications


Min 2 years hands-on experience in Data Analytics / Business Analytics / CRM / Reporting, incluidng experience in data mining related activities.
Able to query databases and other information sources independently.
Excellent knowledge of at least one reporting / data mining tool: SQL, Snowflake, KNIME, Power BI.
Excellent Analytical Skills.


Bonus points if you


Have experience in reporting, retention activities, statical modelling, digital analytics.
International exposure or experience in working with international teams.


People are at the heart of our success - all 14,000 of them for Nespresso globally. We actively cultivate diversity, inclusion and belonging in the workplace. We celebrate individuality, believing that your authenticity and uniqueness can help us to grow and thrive together

#Nespresso

Title: Data Analyst - (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We're looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How will you make a difference

Review the weekly metrics for each project: Analyze the main KPIs and identify potential issues and/or areas for improvement. Prepare a weekly report for the meeting with Product and Marketing.
Prepare a Quarterly Project Report with an analysis of the main KPIs.
Analyze potential ad hoc incidents.
Examine the impacts of implemented changes.
Analyze A/B Test results.
Evaluate the impact of SEO/SEM changes.

Your team

We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and that the team's success is your success, then you're one of us!

Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the office. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.

Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

At least 3 years of experience working in Data Analysis and user flow.
Experience in e-commerce.
Knowledge of GA4 Analytics.
Experience in data management/analysis, preferably with QlikSense.
Knowledge of SQL
Understanding of data analysis/extraction (optional).
Knowledge of Amplitude (optional).



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Location

Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

The personal data you provide will be used solely to manage your candidacy for the purposes of this position. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
What are we looking for?

Blue is looking for a bright, analytical, team member who thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment to bring digital and operations expertise to the fast-growing digital industry. This Junior Data Analyst will be responsible for trafficking, organizing, and optimizing ad campaigns in both European and CIS markets to ensure the success of Blue’s advertisers in addition to provide outstanding customer service to our clients.

The candidate will be trained thoroughly in Blue's systems and will have support from the superior.

Who are we?

Blue delivers online marketing campaigns to clients in 27 markets, we offer our product on a "no cure no pay" solution. We help our customers to optimize and make the online advertising market transparent, clear, and blue.

Responsibilities


Full campaigns result analysis
Results analysis by category/market/size
Line Item analysis
Case studies creation
Revenue and traffic projections of campaigns
Campaign commission increase analysis



Skills


Organized
Number-oriented
Good with deadlines
Analytical skills
Creative with ideas
Attention to detail



Applicants must have a Spanish work permit and be able to work at our office in San Pedro de Alcantara. Not Remote.

Job Info

Seniority Level: Entry-level

Industry: Marketing and Advertising

Employment Type: Full-time

Job placement: Marbella, Spain

Job Functions: Advertising, Campaigns and Clients management

Opening: As soon as possible

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desde SOTEC buscamos incorporar un perfil Analista unirse al equipo de Implantación y Mejora en un proyecto estratégico en modalidad Híbrida. Este rol es esencial para la gestión y optimización de procesos utilizando la herramienta DUCO.




Funciones




Gestión y optimización de procesos en DUCO
Soporte a usuarios
Elaboración de informes KPI
Coordinación con proveedores
Integración de APIs
Análisis y mejora de procesos




Requisitos




Experiencia en análisis de datos. Automatización/Gestión de Incidencias.
Nivel Alto de inglés
Conocimientos Técnicos en JavaScript, APIs, HTML




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Modalidad: Híbrida
Desarrollo profesional
Ambiente inclusivo y diverso
Proyectos desafiantes
Beneficios competitivos




Si estás listo para unirte a una empresa que valora el talento y fomenta el crecimiento, ¡queremos conocerte! Trabajarás en un proyecto clave para un cliente de alto perfil, con una gran visibilidad y relevancia con oportunidad de crecer y desarrollar nuevas habilidades en un entorno tecnológico avanzado.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 · Fundraising round of 40M€ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers

2022 · Fundraising round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag’s data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag’s commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

🚀 Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

💯 One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., 🏖️)

🍽️🚘 Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance

⌛ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

🏋 Gympass

🇬🇧 🇪🇸 🇫🇷 Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

📚 Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

🍻 We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand’s customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What’s in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor’s degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional—can be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you’re a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client’s sales teams worldwide.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.




It's with that in mind that Beyond is looking to add an Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. Reporting to our Director, Revenue Operations, you will play a critical role in delivering actionable and meaningful metrics to both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insights that enable our internal teams to gain a holistic understanding of how our products and services connect with each other, and with our customers.




To excel in this position, you should possess a strong technical background and a proven track record in developing reporting, business intelligence, and data solutions. We’re looking for someone hands-on, results-oriented, and eager to work cross-functionally.




Before reading further…

Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team’s potential. If you’re hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!




As our Associate Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for:

Data, Data, & more Data - Analyze & optimize our current data transformation pipelines. Create new data models to support business insights & monitor data quality.
Technical Partnership - Partner closely with other Tech, Product and Data engineering teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics, projects & new data initiatives.
Harvesting insights - Enabling effective decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Business Expertise - Leveraging a deep, data-driven understanding of the key drivers and metrics underpinning Beyond’s products and business lines to draw insights and make recommendations that will help the company grow and scale effectively.
Showing the way to key stakeholders - Conduct deep-dive analysis with complex SQL queries and translate requirements into effective & innovative data visualizations and solutions in Mode. Partnering closely with our GTM, Finance & Product teams to support their business objectives through analysis.




So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be an:

Innovator - Insights without action are lost opportunities and you regularly seek new information, try new approaches, and want to increase the pace of learning
Storyteller - You love telling stories with data, and have a playbook for how to bring people along in the process
Explorer - You seek information that challenges assumptions and delight in finding insights that are not obvious.
Advisor - You have the ability to distill and share key data and insights that lead to better decision-making and strategy




Now that we’ve told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:

2+ years of experience working in a Business Intelligence / Analytics environment.
Strong data modeling & proficiency SQL skills with experience working with complex & large data sets.
Experience harnessing data from multiple sources and making it usable and accessible for non-technical users.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools, query engines and data visualization tools (dbt, airflow & Mode are what we use)
Experience articulating business questions, and using available data to find answers that translate into business recommendations.
You have exceptional business intuition and conceptual thinking, with the ability to readily map business processes to the appropriate metrics.
Experience with dbt / Python is a plus




So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:

Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
Interview with our Director, Revenue Operations & BI
Complete a technical assignment
Meet with our team for deeper dive video conversations
Interview with our Chief Revenue Officer
Interview with our Chief Technology Officer/Cofounder




Company Values:

We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.




Benefits:

Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!




We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:

Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.

Show more

Title: Analista de datos junior
Description:
DESCRIPCIÓN DE LA OFERTA

Somos el operador que está construyendo el futuro de las telecomunicaciones en España, donde estamos presentes desde 2008 y más de 6,1 millones de clientes ya confían en nosotros. Ofrecemos servicios de telefonía móvil y fija, así como de fibra en todas las provincias de España. Además, desplegamos nuestra propia red de fibra en los principales núcleos urbanos del país. Contamos ya con más de 7.500 empleados que trabajamos cada día para que nuestros clientes puedan disfrutar de la más alta calidad a nuestro mejor precio posible.

Necesitamos incorporar a un/a analista de datos, que desrrollará las siguientes funciones:

Conocimientos Avanzados, Demostrables y Experiencia Profesional En


Python.
Análisis de calidad de datos.
Transformación y depuración de datos.
Estadística.
Programación: dominar los conceptos teóricos de programación, así como los conceptos relacionados de complejidad computacional. en Python/.
Machine learning.
Validación de análisis y modelos previo a su implementación.
Capacidad de exposición y explicación de análisis y resultados.


REQUISITOS DEL PUESTO


Conocimientos en algoritmos estadísticos utilizados en aprendizaje automático.
Valorable el uso de PowerBI o herramientas de visualización de datos.
Programación (Python)
Manejo y procesamiento de bases de datos.
Microsoft Office (Excel y Power Point).


OTRA INFORMACIÓN

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?


Incorporación a compañía joven, en pleno crecimiento y con grandes oportunidades de promoción.
Contrato: Indefinido.
Horario de Jornada completa
Ticket Restaurante, seguro médico y fibra gratuita en casa

Title: Beca Data Analyst
Description:
Somos una de las principales empresas europeas de gestión inmobiliaria y especialista en inmuebles, con más de 1.500 empleados en 39 oficinas en 8 países.

Ofrecemos a nuestros clientes un amplio e integrado rango de servicios con una especialización en la gestión inmobiliaria. Gestionamos oficinas, edificios, comercios, centros comerciales, activos residenciales, hoteles, logística, activos industriales y muchos más.

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst, para desempeñar las siguientes funciones:


Implementar técnicas avanzadas de limpiado automatizado de correos electrónicos para extraer y organizar eficientemente la información más relevante
Diseñar y desarrollar bases de datos sólidas, así como garantizar su mantenimiento y actualización continúa utilizando lenguaje SQL
Crear y mantener una aplicación personalizada para formularios, asegurando la carga de los datos en tablas para su posterior visualización en informes
Utilizar habilidades de programación para filtrar y analizar conjuntos de datos en hojas de cálculo, con el fin de identificar patrones y tendencias significativas
Participar en la identificación y evaluación de nuevas herramientas y tecnologías relacionadas con el análisis de datos, a fin de mejorar continuamente los procesos y resultados


Requisitos mínimos:


Estudiante o recien graduado del Grado Superior Desarrollo de Aplicaciones Multiplataforma
Habilidades de programación, especialmente en la manipulación y análisis de datos en hojas de cálculo utilizando lenguajes de programación como Python o R
Experiencia en el diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de bases de datos utilizando lenguaje SQL
Nivel avanzado de Inglés


Requisitos deseados:


Nivel alto de Excel
Programación VBA, Power BI (DAX)
Experiencia 2 años en puesto similar


Habilidades/Competencias valorables:


Altamente organizado, con una atención meticulosa a los detalles y capacidad para gestionar múltiples proyectos y prioridades simultáneamente
Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en colaboración dentro de un entorno de equipo


Imprescindible poder realizar convenio de prácticas con la Universidad

Powered by JazzHR

h2oXlrUoWE

  • Implementar técnicas avanzadas de limpiado automatizado de correos electrónicos para extraer y organizar eficientemente la información más relevante
  • Diseñar y desarrollar bases de datos sólidas, así como garantizar su mantenimiento y actualización continúa utilizando lenguaje SQL
  • Crear y mantener una aplicación personalizada para formularios, asegurando la carga de los datos en tablas para su posterior visualización en informes
  • Utilizar habilidades de programación para filtrar y analizar conjuntos de datos en hojas de cálculo, con el fin de identificar patrones y tendencias significativas
  • Participar en la identificación y evaluación de nuevas herramientas y tecnologías relacionadas con el análisis de datos, a fin de mejorar continuamente los procesos y resultados

Requisitos mínimos:

  • Estudiante o recien graduado del Grado Superior Desarrollo de Aplicaciones Multiplataforma
  • Habilidades de programación, especialmente en la manipulación y análisis de datos en hojas de cálculo utilizando lenguajes de programación como Python o R
  • Experiencia en el diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de bases de datos utilizando lenguaje SQL
  • Nivel avanzado de Inglés

Requisitos deseados:

  • Nivel alto de Excel
  • Programación VBA, Power BI (DAX)
  • Experiencia 2 años en puesto similar

Habilidades/Competencias valorables:

  • Altamente organizado, con una atención meticulosa a los detalles y capacidad para gestionar múltiples proyectos y prioridades simultáneamente
  • Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en colaboración dentro de un entorno de equipo

Imprescindible poder realizar convenio de prácticas con la Universidad

Powered by JazzHR

h2oXlrUoWE

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (H/M/X)
Description:
Desde ManpowerGroup buscamos un/a Business Intelligence Analyst para una multinacional del sector Gran Consumo que lleva operando más de 100 años a nivel global. La posición está ubicada en Madrid.




Responsabilidades principales:

Desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes analíticos para diferentes departamentos, especialmente departamento comercial.




Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos provenientes de diversas fuentes, identificar tendencias y proporcionar insights para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas.




Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para entender sus necesidades de datos, proponer soluciones analíticas y optimizar procesos existentes.




Requisitos:




Licenciatura o Maestría en Matemáticas, Física, Ingeniería o Ciencias de la Computación.
Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos e inteligencia empresarial.
Inglés: alto
Experiencia con conjuntos de datos complejos y en el apoyo al desarrollo de estrategia.
Habilidad para desarrollar conocimientos empresariales a partir de datos de forma autónoma.
Experiencia en creación de productos analíticos y en visualización, consulta y gestión de datos.
Mentalidad de experimentación y capacidad para aprender y adaptarse rápidamente.
Experiencia ideal en temas analíticos de bienes de consumo en diferentes países y unidades de negocio.




Habilidades técnicas:




SQL
Excel y PowerBI / DAX.
Snowflake (deseable)
Phyton
Conocimientos en Ciencias Estadísticas.




Se ofrece:




Crecimiento profesional
Ambiente dinámico
Beneficios atractivos
Acceso a tecnología avanzada
Flexibilidad laboral

Title: Business Data Analyst (E-Commerce)
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a Business Data Analyst con experiencia entre 3-5 años para incorporarse al departamento e-commerce 💥




¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Por qué trabajar aquí?




👉FORMACIÓN PERSONALIZADA: Dispondrás de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars y Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching...

👉MODELO DE TRABAJO HIBRIDO: 1 día oficina.

👉PAQUETE DE RETRIBUCIÓN FLEXIBLE: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).

👉SOMOS UNA FAMILIA: Cuidamos de esta gran familia organizando afterworks, cenas y eventos 🍻.




Funciones:




Construir el modelo de datos utilizado por el Departamento de Marketing para monitorear la eficiencia de las campañas de rendimiento.
Desarrollo de dashboards usando Looker Studio for Sales,
Solución de problemas y profundización en las campañas de marketing pago para desarrollar propuestas de optimización.
Ejecución de Google Tag Manager para seguimiento y mejorar campañas de marketing.
Generar valor a través de métricas y vincularlas a un modelo de datos que impacta el negocio.
Llevar a cabo controles de calidad de los datos para garantizar su exactitud.
Documentación de procedimientos y modelos de datos.
Español: Nativo / Inglés: Avanzado

Formación y conocimientos:




Valorable un formación en Análisis de Datos y Marketing Digital.
Google Analytics (UA, 360 y GA4), Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, Sisense y Supermetrics.
Excel, Hojas de cálculo de Google, Google Optimize y Google Tag Manager.
SQL, Python, BigQuery
Ágil y Kanban




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países, por lo que podrás disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura, como en este caso.




💙¡SOMOS UN EXCELENTE LUGAR DE TRABAJO! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Title: Analista Business Intelligence
Description:
¡En @Ayesa crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨




Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos somos más de 12.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países.

Si eres una persona entusiasta, te apasiona la #tecnología y buscas un nuevo reto profesional ¡Este es tu sitio!




Buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Analista Programador/a Business Intelligence en modalidad híbrida.




¡Anímate a dar el salto! ¡Te estamos esperando!




Funciones:




- Colaboración en el análisis y diseño de los casos de uso a implementar en la Oficina del Dato de la organización.

- Visión técnica global de la solución alineada con los objetivos del proyecto.

- Gestión de estructuras de datos incluyendo diseño, creación, supervisión, administración e implementación.

- Definición de modelos de lógica de datos y estándares como fuente de información única.

- Seguimiento de los diferentes procesos de Extracción, Transformación y Carga de datos de los sistemas origen.

- Desarrollar estrategias de arquitectura de bases de datos SQL y NoSQL.

- Optimización de la fiabilidad, calidad y confiabilidad de los datos.

- Realizar conexiones, flujos de datos, y procesos entre los distintos data sets.

- Manejo de herramientas de gestión, modelado y visualización de información.

- Asesoramiento y participación en las reuniones de seguimiento con los proveedores.

- Revisión y control para la correcta gobernanza del dato y documentación.

- Elaboración de material formativo para los técnicos de primer nivel y usuarios finales.







Te ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:

🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.

🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.

🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.

🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.

🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.

🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.

🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.

¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎




Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, Ayesa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación efectiva del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso.

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be analytical support for senior team members and Client Business Partners. A Junior Insight Analyst will be in support of 1 or several clients. This role will be part of an International Community with the expectation of being connected with other Support Centre Analysts and the broader International Analytical Community in order to encourage best practice sharing & collection.

Responsibilities


Assist with the execution of projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations.
Analyze and interpret sales data and consumer data.
Summarize data in tables, charts, and graphs, review data for errors and inconsistencies.
Draft reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
Set up and refresh cyclical reports.
Support Client Business Partners and Nielsen Local Teams on quotations requested from Client
Connect as appropriate with the broader international analytic community for best practices approach understanding and sharing.


a Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you.

Qualifications


University degree or a last year student in Business/Marketing/Economics or related field
Strong numerical, analytical and written presentation skills
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint
Good written and spoken communication skills in English
Results-oriented personality and ability to work to tight deadlines
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as an enthusiastic team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG industry is an asset


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remote Lisbon
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits:


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Middle/Senior Data Analyst (FinTech Domain)
Description:
Company Description

We're seeking an accomplished Data Analyst with expertise in data visualization and statistical analysis, proficient in tools such as SQL, Python, and Tableau. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative team environment. This role goes beyond data crunching, encompassing responsibilities in data modeling, data interpretation, reporting, technical design, testing, documentation, and maintenance.

Our client has rapidly become one of Europe’s most fastest-growing fintech companies. They manage all aspects of financial operations, from generating virtual cards to facilitating wire transfers and maintaining customer account balances. As a payment institution, our client provides a platform integrating financial services into its product, including features like account management, card payments, bank transfers, and additional services.

CUSTOMER

Our customer is a leading FinTech company founded in 2016, offering a comprehensive spending solution designed for finance teams to facilitate faster and smarter spending decisions. Rapidly growing, they now serve over 4,000 customers and boast an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote locations. They have raised over €260M from prominent investors and have been recognized as a tech unicorn in France, with ambitious plans for continued expansion.

, Job Description


Collect, organize, and maintain accurate high-quality data from various sources
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and troubleshoot any data-related issues
Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards; communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders
Design and implement data analytics solutions for specific business domains, utilizing data science tools and techniques
Support process improvement initiatives by providing data-driven insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Work closely with clients and business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure high-quality data reporting, and deliver impactful presentations


, Qualifications


3+ years of Data-related experience
Proven ability to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data reporting
Strong knowledge of Python
Significant experience with Looker
Proficiency in visual analytics tools such as Power BI and Tableau
Strong experience in communicating effectively with clients and business stakeholders
Ability to deliver impactful presentations and convey key points from data analysis
Good understanding of machine learning instruments and algorithms
Broad experiencein exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
Experience in implementing and delivering data science and analytics solutions with measurable business impact
At least an Upper-Intermediate level of English

, Job Description

  • Collect, organize, and maintain accurate high-quality data from various sources
  • Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and troubleshoot any data-related issues
  • Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards; communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders
  • Design and implement data analytics solutions for specific business domains, utilizing data science tools and techniques
  • Support process improvement initiatives by providing data-driven insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
  • Work closely with clients and business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure high-quality data reporting, and deliver impactful presentations

, Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Data-related experience
  • Proven ability to ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data reporting
  • Strong knowledge of Python
  • Significant experience with Looker
  • Proficiency in visual analytics tools such as Power BI and Tableau
  • Strong experience in communicating effectively with clients and business stakeholders
  • Ability to deliver impactful presentations and convey key points from data analysis
  • Good understanding of machine learning instruments and algorithms
  • Broad experiencein exploratory data analysis and feature engineering
  • Experience in implementing and delivering data science and analytics solutions with measurable business impact
  • At least an Upper-Intermediate level of English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ECI is the leading global provider of managed services, cybersecurity, and business transformation for mid-market financial services organizations across the globe. From its unmatched range of services, ECI provides stability, security and improved business performance, freeing clients from technology concerns and enabling them to focus on running their businesses. More than 1,000 customers worldwide with over $3 trillion of assets under management put their trust in ECI.

At ECI, we believe success is driven by passion and purpose. Our passion for technology is only surpassed by our commitment to empowering our employees around the world.

The Opportunity:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the development and deployment of Power BI reports and their underlying datasets, to provide analytics to a wide range of functional teams at ECI. This person will lead projects to bring and enhance visibility into key enterprise metrics and drive action based on the resulting insights. The successful candidate should be skilled at asking probing questions for clarity and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiences. This role requires advanced proficiency working with complex SQL queries.

The ideal candidate is a motivated, detail-oriented individual who is equally comfortable with back-end data structures, visualization, and storytelling.

This is an Onsite role.

What you will do:


Reporting: Create PowerBI reports and dashboards that provide insights to stakeholders
Data Modeling: Design and develop data models that support business requirements
Data Vizualization: Create visualizations that help stakeholders understand complex data insights
Deployment: Oversee the QA and deployment of reporting made available for consumption; Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing, conducting demos, participating in stakeholder reviews, as well as assuming the role of post-release Subject Matter Expert
Data Integrity: Communicate frequently when reports are under maintenance
Requirement Gathering: Responsible for working with other groups to efficiently define requirements and support their business objectives; these requirements will be used for tasks assigned to this role and tasks assigned to data analysts
User Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to analyze and isolate root cause of data issues and drive data cleansing efforts
Documentation: Maintain SharePoint knowledge base documentation related to solution requirements, data flow diagrams, business glossary and data lineage


Who you are:


Should have 4+ years of relevant experience.
Education/Experience: College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information science, management information systems, or business administration or a related field or equal years of experience
Data Analysis: Proven track record of analyzing large datasets and extracting meaningful insights from them
Statistics and Databases: Firm understanding of statistics and databases to be able work with data effectively
Problem Solving: Ability to identify problems and develop solutions that can help the org achieve its goals
Communication: Strong communication skills to be able to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and collaborate with other departments to achieve common goals
Change Management: experience creating reports in a sandbox before pushing to Production
Dedicated to innovation of existing operational processes
Ability to effectively prioritize and negotiate tradeoffs with stakeholders
Proficiency with ETL methodologies & syncing data across disparate systems
4+ years related experience and building analytic solutions
4+ years working with SQL and databases
Experience navigating large datasets
Exceptional at finding trends in data
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics to help differentiate between correlation and causation


Bonus points if you have:


Working Python experience, a plus


ECI’s culture is all about connection - connection with our clients, our technology and most importantly with each other. In addition to working with an amazing team around the world, ECI offers a competitive compensation package and so much more! If you believe you’d be a great fit and are ready for your best job ever, we’d like to hear from you!

Love Your Job, Share Your Technology Passion, Create Your Future Here!


Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst (M/F/D)
Description:
Descrição da Função

Are you passionate about your filed, but you are not being challenged in your workplace ?

Would you like to work in a global company with a good environment?

If so , read what we have for you.

Adecco Recruitment is looking for a Junior Data Analyst for a cliente in Lisbon.

Function

Acquire 360 knowledge of Data & Analytics data architecture, data management, data visualization and data analysis.

Develop hard skills in the use of Business Intelligence technologies and soft skills to relate to the customer and their work team.

Ability to move and interact in an international, fast and dynamic environment gradually assuming greater responsibilities and autonomy in tasks.

Requirements

Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis and visualization (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics), or equivalent work experience.

Solid knowledge of SQL programming (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases).

Good written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.

Excellent follow-through, commitment and accountability.

Strong team player, positive work ethic and contributor to our fun work environment.

Unyielding thirst for knowledge.

Feel free to send us your CV.

ENVIAR CANDIDATURA

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Consultor de Power BI
Description:
Na IRIUMqueremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos! Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto disfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura de Consultor de Power BI

O que esperamos de ti?

Perfil Obrigatório:


Mínimo de 5 anos de experiência;
Conhecimento aprofundado em Power BI & DAX;
Experiência em modelação e análise de dados e em construção de relatórios;
Disponível com brevidade, para começar a 2 de Setembro;
Cliente da área dos Serviços;
Duração do projeto: é um projeto que tem renovações automáticas


Localização: Projeto Presencial no centro de Lisboa (Marquês de Pombal);

O que oferecemos?

➡ Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.

➡ Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance. Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.

➡ Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos. Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho. Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A PTC Group está à procura de um Júnior Data Analyst para juntar-se à nossa equipa de Data Analytics e Reporting, em Lisboa, para o sector bancário.

Responsabilidades


Criar dashboards e relatórios em PowerBI.
Colaborar na preparação de relatórios sobre a atividade operational bancária.
Identificar e propor melhorias nos processos operacionais e serviços.

Otimização dos processos ETL.

Formação, Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Gestão, Economia, Análise de Dados ou Computer Science.
Experiência de +1 ano em ferramentas de visualização e análise de dados como SQL, Python e PowerBI.
Conhecimento em otimização de processos ETL.
Conhecimentos em análise descritiva e preditiva.

Title: Assurance Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Lisbon, Portugal

Competitive Salary And Benefits Apply

We are a diverse, inclusive and innovative group who identify, build and deliver excellent shared services (which everyone can leverage) to enable AstraZeneca to grow and change at speed. We are passionate about simple process – making it easier to get vital repeatable services done – for our patients, for our customers, for our teams.  

  

We focus on providing exceptional value that contributes to our company’s success and future by freeing up the business (our customers) to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines for patients.  With the accomplishments, commitment and passion that you bring, I’m excited about what we will achieve together towards realizing AstraZeneca’s bold ambition.  

Join the Global Business Services (GBS) Analytics team, a part of the Finance function, focused on helping customers get actionable insights from data. As an Assurance Data Analyst, you will be part of a high performing, multi-disciplinary team, delivering analytical products helping customers in Compliance, Internal Audit and related assurance functions take data driven decisions.

Accountabilities:

Your responsibilities will include gathering requirements, designing analytical reports/dashboards and supporting customers to get insights from data. You will manage and execute reports aligned to customers’ requirements and identify opportunities to improve data quality. You will also respond to ad-hoc data analysis and reporting queries and identify opportunities to continuously improve the analytics, monitoring and insights to increase customer satisfaction.

Essential Skills/Experience:



Professional experience within data analysis
Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills
Ability to work with senior stakeholders and confidential data
Strong ability to work independently
Strong understanding of processes and controls
Strong ethical, collaborative and influencing skills
Global / cross-cultural experience
Excellent computer skills (including Excel, PowerPoint and other data analysis / reporting software)
Experience in using data visualization software (in particular Power BI)
Ability to work well across diverse global team
English language proficiency, both verbal and written.



Desirable Skills/Experience:



Experience in pharmaceuticals or a related industry
Knowledge or experience of using key source systems (e.g. SAP, Concur, Veeva, Workday)
Knowledge and experience of corporate governance, health care regulations, laws and standards (e.g. ABAC, FCPA, EFPIA, etc.)
Experience in an audit, risk or compliance role
Additional language(s) both written and verbal.



When we put diverse teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science, challenge convention and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. To embrace differences and take bold actions to drive the change needed to meet global healthcare and sustainability challenges. There is no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture where you will connect different thinking to generate new and valuable opportunities. Where you will find a commitment to lifelong learning, growth and development for all.

Ready to make a powerful difference? Apply now!

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a motivated and driven Business Data Analyst  who will help us steer and optimize the cost of our Bus Partnership globally as well as streamline our supply process. 

Flix' success is based on long-term partnerships with our bus partners with whom we share responsibilities for cost and revenues. The Global Business Excellence team runs projects and steers bus partner managers in minimizing production costs and hence in improving the profitability of our partnership.

You will join a growing, cross-functional and tech-supported team and bring our analytics and steering to the next level. In doing so you will work with all Flix local teams (+30 Countries) to achieve common solutions we can scale our business with.

Your Tasks – Paint the world green

  • You participate in and/or also drive yourself high-impact projects affecting our running operations with a high degree of autonomy and take on large responsibilities from day one, with exposure to top management;
  • You work closely with various HQ functions as well as stakeholders from individual local Flix offices spread around the globe who are in direct contact with our bus partners to explore and understand their work and requirements in order to define and build analytics solutions that best suit their needs;
  • You create and develop methods, tools and suitable KPIs for our performance management around bus partnership costs;
  • You analyze data and challenge decision proposals; You prepare analysis for our management and recommend decisions;
  • You take part in and support our global supply and network planning process by analyzing data along the way;
  • You proactively develop new approaches in benchmarking costs and understanding our bus partners sustainability;
  • You develop your own predictive models and/or simulation tools which will be used by our local BD teams to calculate and understand the impact of negotiations and decisions;
  • You help us understand possible cost optimization projects and initiate those;
  • You become an expert in Flix data landscape to serve as a point of contact to various stakeholders from business and tech who need data insights to inform their projects;
  • You collect data from multiple sources and create reports that help you and management analyze performance and understand our partnerships' sustainability;
  • In all of that, you support the implementation of global supply chain strategy to achieve sustainable growth.

Your Profile – Ready to hop on board

  • You have a successfully completed university degree, preferably in the field of Business Administration, Mathematics, Statistics, Social Sciences, Business Informatics, Economics or similar;
  • You have at least 2 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Controller or similar with considerable experience in Project Management;
  • You have very strong analytical skills, have a good understanding of business contexts and a quick grasp of complex issues;
  • You are familiar with common methods and tools for cleaning and merging different data sources as well as data preparation and visualization;
  • You have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and in data visualization tools like Power BI and/or Tableau;
  • You bring good knowledge of SQL, being proficient in a programming language (e.g. Python) is a plus;
  • You are able to independently drive your own projects including conducting exploration/research in order to define what needs to be done;
  • You are not afraid to explore complicated topics with sometimes conflicting requirements from diverse set of stakeholders in order to evaluate them and achieve common consensus with resulting solution definition;
  • You have excellent and precise verbal and written communication skills in English;
  • You have good presentation skills and feel comfortable in presenting to larger audiences;
  • You have an entrepreneurial spirit, are strongly driven, self-organized, structured, an independent worker, and highly reliable.

Our Perks – More than just a job

  • You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
  • Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
  • Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
  • Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
  • We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
  • Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Data Analyst | Digital Transformation (DX) Team
HTML:
Job Description

Data Analyst | Fujitsu Portugal GDC

Your future is Fujitsu

At Fujitsu, our focus on human-centric innovation is impacting the way the world transforms to a digital future. We see it on a global and local scale, and we know that the power of innovation and human connection can create a more trusting, sustainable and responsible world for all. We are looking to grow our team with committed people to work in a challenging, but extremely rewarding environment using the latest technology to offer groundbreaking solutions to everyday problems for our customers. This is your world and your opportunity to shape it for the better.

Shape your world

As Data Analyst you will support the programme globally as part of the Digital Transformation (DX), a new team coordinated centrally with new roles. The team will be responsible for developing, customizing and managing intelligent systems. These tools and technologies will drive the global wide road-map defined by GD. You will work collaboratively with an analytics team to look at data, find relations and give data driven recommendations that address key business questions.

Responsibilities

The role holder will form part of DX and work collaboratively with an analytics team to look at data, find relations and give data driven recommendations that address key business questions.

  • Develop records management processes and policies;
  • Collects, processes and cleanses data;
  • Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques
  • Develop and support reporting processes;
  • Monitor and audit data quality;
  • Liaise with internal and external clients to fully understand data content;
  • Gather, understand and document detailed business requirements using appropriate tools and techniques;
  • Manipulate, analyze and interpret complex data sets relating to the employer's business;
  • Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using business analytics reporting tools;
  • Create data d ashboards, graphs and visualizations;
  • Provide sector and competitor benchmarking;
  • Be a self starter and pro active member of a team;
  • Adhere to agreed methodology, governance and controls.

Desired Experience & Knowledge

  • Knowledge in Data exploration and Data visualization tools or packages (BI Experience);
  • Able to co relate different sources of data;
  • Skills in one or more area is a plus: Splunk, ELK Stack, Tableau, Power BI or Talend;
  • Data modeling and SQL knowledge
  • Experience in designing and developing ETL data pipelines;
  • Data cleaning and data wrangling t ools used to reshape the data;
  • Experience in designing and building dimensional data models to improve accessibility, efficiency, and quality of data;
  • Expertise in performance tuning of SQL queries.

Core Competencies

  • Self starter committed, focused and self motivated;
  • Flexibility ability to multi task, adapt to change and manage a fast paced high stress environment;
  • Hands on willingness and ability to work the details; demonstrated ability with implementing and managing issues and initiatives;
  • Communication Skills excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Dealing with ambiguity ability to make progre ss in situations where required details aren’t always available.

Shape the world by working your way

We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all and to offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Work from home possibility, from anywhere in Portugal
  • Employment directly with Fujitsu with possibility of permanent contract
  • Work life balance with part-time/ full-time schedules available and 25 annual leave days
  • International career in a dynamic and enthusiastic environment
  • Training and internal career progression plan upon hiring
  • Several discounts available with our partners
  • The chance to get involved in our Social Responsibility program and participate in several initiatives with focus on well-being, diversity and inclusion, environment and our community
  • If you are moving to Portugal we also offer the support of our Welcome Buddy to help you settle in.
  • inclusion, environment and our community (medical services, Yoga lessons, fresh fruit, volunteering afternoons)
  • Great Facilities at Central locations well served by public transportation, bicycle access and services
  • Remote Working Available
  • … and much more!

Title: Expert Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to develop your professional career in a large international company? Are you interested in big opportunities? DHL Cross-Border Solutions has great job opportunities to start or further develop your career! Join us in an international and multicultural environment with hybrid work system, flexibility, and plenty of development opportunities.

DHL Cross-Border Solutions is part of DHL eCommerce, the newest member of the DHL family. Our mission is to become a European leader in cross-border parcel delivery by developing customized shipping solutions for international eCommerce customers.

To adapt processes and workstreams to the rapid business growth of the last 2 years, our most important goal is to integrate Business Intelligence into all our business processes. We are therefore looking for additional support in our team.

As an Expert Data Analyst (M/F/X) you will turn raw business data into critical and coordinated information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions.

Your tasks:



Delivering high-complexity projects involving collaboration with multiple international stakeholders from all business functions and countries across Europe to define, set up, and maintain monitoring and steering tools, continuously improve processes, and support their implementation.
Supporting the collection of reporting requirements and organizing BI trainings with CBS countries and business functions.
Contributing to the overall business intelligence strategy and monitoring stakeholders' and countries' efforts to align with the overall strategy.
Establishing strong relationships with and reporting to country managing directors and the central Senior Management Team.



Your profile:



At least 3 years of working experience with Power BI or other relevant Data Analysis tools.
Preferably first experience in BI and analytics related projects.
Hands-on experience with Reporting, dashboard development and modelling.
Proficient in Data Science Projects, Machine-Learning Models, knowledge of Python is a plus.
High analytical skills.
Flexible and able to work on several projects at the same time whilst setting the right priorities.
Fluent English is a must, German or any other European language is a plus.



Your benefits:

We offer excellent employee benefits, a competitive salary package and great development opportunities. We welcome full-time (40 hours) and offer a hybrid work system.

We look forward to your application. Join us in connecting people and improving lives.

CONNECTING PEOPLE. IMPROVING LIVES.
Show more
